ul.li1: 1How, in his anger,Literally “in his nose”
the Lord has covered the daughter of Zion in a cloud!
He has thrown down from heavens to earth
ul.li2: the splendor of Israel,
ul.li1: and he has not remembered his footstool
ul.li2: in the day of his anger.Literally “his nose”
ul.li1: 2The Lord has devoured; he has not shown mercy
ul.li2: to all the dwellings of Jacob;
ul.li1: he has broken down in his wrath
ul.li2: the fortifications of the daughter of Judah;
ul.li1: he has leveled to the ground, he has dishonored
ul.li2: the kingdom and its commanders.Or “her commanders”
ul.li1: 3He has cut down in fierce angerLiterally “in a fierce nose”
ul.li2: all the might of Israel;
ul.li1: he has withdrawn his right hand
ul.li2: from the faces of the enemy,
ul.li1: and he has burned in Jacob like a flaming fire,
ul.li2: it has consumed all around.
ul.li1: 4He has bent his bow like an enemy;
ul.li2: he has set his right hand
ul.li1: like a foe, and he has slain
ul.li2: all the treasures of the eye;NRSV translates “all in whom we took pride”
ul.li1: in the tent of the daughter of Zion,
ul.li2: he has poured out his anger like fire.
ul.li1: 5The Lord has become like an enemy;
ul.li2: he has destroyed Israel;
ul.li1: he has destroyed all its citadel fortresses;Or “her citadel fortresses”
ul.li2: he has ruined all its fortifications
ul.li1: and multiplied lamentation and mourning
ul.li2: in the daughter of Judah.
ul.li1: 6He has broken down his dwellingLiterally “his booth”; or “his tabernacle” place like the garden;
ul.li2: he has ruined his appointed feasts;
ul.li1: Yahweh has made them forget in Zion
ul.li2: festivalLiterally “appointed time” and Sabbath,
ul.li1: and he has despised in his anger
ul.li2: king and priest.
ul.li1: 7The Lord has rejected his altar;
ul.li2: he has rejected his sanctuary;
ul.li1: he has delivered into the hands of the enemy
ul.li2: the walls of its citadel fortresses.Or “her citadel fortress”
ul.li1: They have cried out in the house of Yahweh
ul.li2: like a day of an appointed feast.
ul.li1: 8Yahweh has planned to destroy
ul.li2: the wall of the daughter of Zion.
ul.li1: He measured with a line; he has not restrained
ul.li2: his hand from destroying;
ul.li1: he caused rampart and wall to mourn;
ul.li2: together they have languished away.
ul.li1: 9Her gates have sunk into the earth;
ul.li2: he has ruined and broken her bars,
ul.li1: her kings and its princes are among the nations;
ul.li2: there is no more law.Hebrew torah
ul.li1: Also, her prophets have not found
ul.li2: a revelation from Yahweh.
ul.li1: 10They sit on the ground,
ul.li2: the elders of the daughter of Zion are silent.
ul.li1: They cast dust on their head,
ul.li2: they have put on sackcloth;
ul.li1: the young women of Jerusalem
ul.li2: have bowed their head down to the ground.
ul.li1: 11My eyes have spent all their tears;Literally “finished with the weeping”
ul.li2: my stomachLiterally “my inward parts” is in torment,
ul.li1: my heartLiterally “my liver” is poured out on the earth
ul.li2: because of the destruction of the daughter of my people,
ul.li1: because child and babe faint
ul.li2: in the public squares of a city.
ul.li1: 12To their mothers they say,
ul.li2: “Where is the bread and wine?”
ul.li1: as they faint like the wounded
ul.li2: in the public squares of a city,
ul.li1: as their life is being poured out
ul.li2: onto the bosom of their mothers.
ul.li1: 13What can I say for you? What can I compare to you,
ul.li2: O daughter of Jerusalem?
ul.li1: To what can I liken you so that I can comfort you,
ul.li2: O virgin daughter of Zion?
ul.li1: For your destruction is as vast as the sea;
ul.li2: who can heal you?
ul.li1: 14Your prophets had a vision for you,
ul.li2: false and worthless;
ul.li1: they have not exposed your sin,
ul.li2: to restore your fortune;
ul.li1: they have seen oracles for you,
ul.li2: false and misleading.
ul.li1: 15They clap hands over you,
ul.li2: all who pass along the way;
ul.li1: they hiss and they shake their head,
ul.li2: at the daughter of Jerusalem.
ul.li1: Is this the city of which it is said,
ul.li2: “A perfection of beauty, a joy for all the earth?”
ul.li1: 16They have opened their mouths against you,
ul.li2: all your enemies.
ul.li1: They hiss and gnash a tooth,
ul.li2: and they say, “We have destroyed her!
ul.li1: Surely this is the day we have hoped for;
ul.li2: we have found it, we have seen it!”
ul.li1: 17Yahweh has done what he has planned;
ul.li2: he has fulfilled his promise
ul.li1: that he ordained from the days of old;
ul.li2: he has demolished and not shown mercy;
ul.li1: he has made an enemy rejoice over you,
ul.li2: he has exalted the mightLiterally “horn” of your foes.
ul.li1: 18Their heart cried to the Lord,
ul.li2: “O wall of the daughter of Zion,
ul.li1: let tears stream down like a river;
ul.li2: day and night,
ul.li1: do not give yourself relief,
ul.li2: do not give your eyes rest.
ul.li1: 19“Arise, cry out in the night,
ul.li2: at the beginning of the night watches;
ul.li1: pour out your heart like water,
ul.li2: before the face of the Lord.
ul.li1: Lift to him your hands,
ul.li2: for the life of your children,
ul.li1: who faint in starvation,
ul.li2: at the head of all streets.”
ul.li1: 20See, Yahweh, and take note!
ul.li2: With whom have you dealt thus?
ul.li1: Should women eat their young
ul.li2: children of tender care?
ul.li1: Should priest and prophet be slain
ul.li2: in the sanctuary of the Lord?
ul.li1: 21They lie in the soil of the streets,
ul.li2: young and old;
ul.li1: my young womenOr “my virgins” and young men,
ul.li2: they have fallen by the sword;
ul.li1: you have slain on the day of your anger,Literally “your nose”
ul.li2: you have slaughtered and not shown mercy.
ul.li1: 22You have summoned my horror from all around,
ul.li2: as if for a feast day;
ul.li1: no one on the day of Yahweh’s anger
ul.li2: is a fugitive and a survivor;
ul.li1: whoever I have cared for and reared,
ul.li2: my enemy has destroyed.
